summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell. It indicates the ongoing legal proceedings against Maxwell in late 2020.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center to whom discovery materials are being sent in connection with her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the Acting U.S. Attorney who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecutor overseeing the government's case against defendant Maxwell, as evidenced by this official correspondence transmitting discovery.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

keyFacts: As of December 3, 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, led by Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, was actively prosecuting Maxwell under case number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
The document is official correspondence transmitting discovery materials to Maxwell, indicating an ongoing pre-trial phase in her criminal case.
